item.title: Quicksort in Coq
item.description: The definition of Quicksort To start with, here's the classic definition of quicksort in Haskell. quicksort :: [Int] -> [Int] quicksort l = case l of (x:rest) -> let (less_than_x, greater_than_x) = partition (< x) rest in quicksort less_than_x ++ [x] ++ quicksort greater_than_x [] -> [] If you've not seen this before, in prose it's saying: quicksort :: [Int] -> [Int] quicksort is a function that takes a list of integers, and returns a list of integers.
